item.title: Introduction to Statistics: A modeling-based approach -- Course Syllabus
item.description: Load packages Course description Models and modeling are of pivotal importance in many sciences, not only for providing an explanation of nature en miniature (theoretical models), but also for gauging how closely the empirical data at hand match the theoretical model. Translating a theoretical model into statistical language is called statistical modeling and provides the guiding principle in this introductory course. We will explore how causal and non-causal associations can be translated and tested using simple linear statistical models.
